sub_topic: The Hausdorff dimension of the Sierpinski carpet.
message_1: What is the Hausdorff dimension of the Sierpinski carpet when the space-filling curve is applied 6 times, i.e., the Sierpinski carpet is composed of $3^{6}$ squares? (Answer: $d=\frac{\log(8)}{\log(3)}\approx 1.89279$)
message_2:
The Hausdorff dimension of the Sierpinski carpet is independent of the number of iterations applied to create it. It is a fractal property that remains constant regardless of the number of times the space-filling curve is applied. Therefore, the Hausdorff dimension of the Sierpinski carpet is:

$d = \frac{\log(8)}{\log(3)} \approx 1.89279$
